conversation.content:
[extremely happy] Oh my god, she did it! I mean, honestly, when Sarah walked into that room with those two, um, I was so—[anxious] I thought for sure she'd freeze up, you know? Like she always does when there's confrontation. But then, [gasp softly] the way she just, er, took control? [laugh] I'm sitting there behind the glass thinking "is this really my little dove?" 

[pause] 

She was so—[warm] god, I'm actually getting emotional about this. [sniffle] Six months ago she couldn't even, like, order coffee without rehearsing it first. And today? [excited] Today she's in there saying things like "I hear what you're both saying" and actually, hmm, meaning it! [chuckle] The thing is, I kept wanting to jump in, right? When that first guy started raising his voice, I literally had my hand on the door handle. [quickly] But then Sarah did this thing where she—[impressed] she just took this deep breath and goes "let's take a moment," and honestly? [laugh loudly] They listened! 

[very sincerely] I guess what I'm trying to say is, um, I'm just so damn proud of her. [trailing off] All those practice sessions where she'd turn bright red and stammer... [smiling speaking] Look at her now.

subject: The shy dove you've been mentoring just successfully mediated their first conflict resolution
